data.label: East Sussex County Council – Children’s Services
data.summary: The local authority responsible for children’s social care, safeguarding, early help, and family support services across East Sussex. Delivers statutory and preventative services to support children, young people, and families.

data.notes: Upper-tier local authority in the South East of England with statutory responsibility for children’s social care and family support. Children’s Services includes safeguarding and child protection, early help, support for children in care and care leavers, fostering and adoption, residential care, kinship care, services for children and young people with special educational needs and disabilities (SEND), and targeted support for families facing financial or social hardship. Works in partnership with health, police, education, and the voluntary sector through the East Sussex Safeguarding Children Partnership (ESSCP).

data.label: Standard Safeguarding Dataset (SSD)
data.summary: A Department for Education-funded initiative led by Data to Insight, working with Hertfordshire CC, Essex CC, Knowsley Council and North West ADCS to create a standardised dataset for children’s social care data sharing and outcomes tracking. Based on the SSD
data.search_blob: standard safeguarding dataset (ssd) ssd data_standard safeguarding dfe_funded ddsf ddsf1a systemc mosaic tag azeus eclipse olm sql python a department for education-funded initiative led by data to insight, working with hertfordshire cc, essex cc, knowsley council and north west adcs to create a standardised dataset for children’s social care data sharing and outcomes tracking. based on the ssd services/standard_safeguarding_dataset service
data.notes:
SSD defines a common schema layered on local authority systems. Open-source schema maintained via public repository and updated through partner feedback and implementation experience. 
access_url: https://www.datatoinsight.org/publications-1/standard-safeguarding-dataset---final-report

fields.scope: To create a nationally consistent dataset for safeguarding data collection and use across local authorities, with a focus on interoperability, transparency and analytics.

data.label: Children's Wellbeing and Schools Bill 2024–25
data.summary: Legislation covering safeguarding, support for children in or leaving care, regulation of care workers, breakfast clubs, attendance, and more.
data.search_blob: children's wellbeing and schools bill 2024–25 legislation safeguarding social_care legislation covering safeguarding, support for children in or leaving care, regulation of care workers, breakfast clubs, attendance, and more. events/childrens_wellbeing_schools_bill_2024_25 event
data.notes: Introduced in Parliament December 2024. Proposes statutory measures related to children's welfare, education provision, and system-wide safeguarding responsibilities.

data.label: Methodology Report Children's Social Care in England 2025
data.summary: Quality and methodology documentation supporting Ofsted's annual data publication on children's social care providers, inspections and outcomes in England.
data.search_blob: methodology report children's social care in england 2025 social_care methodology statistics quality and methodology documentation supporting ofsted's annual data publication on children's social care providers, inspections and outcomes in england. events/childrens_social_care_in_england_2025 event
data.notes: This methodology report accompanies Ofsted’s annual release of data and findings. It outlines data sources, inspection processes, and interpretation guidance for national statistics users.

data.label: Children's Social Care Review
data.summary: An independent review commissioned by the Department for Education to evaluate the state of children's social care in England and propose system-wide reforms to improve outcomes for children and families.
data.search_blob: children's social care review social_worker an independent review commissioned by the department for education to evaluate the state of children's social care in england and propose system-wide reforms to improve outcomes for children and families. events/childrens_social_care_review event
data.notes: Led by Josh MacAlister, with contributions from Karen Broadhurst and others. The review informed major reform proposals including the National Framework and investment priorities.
